October 16, 1946
Mra. Jeff Morris
20 Miles Street
Santa Crus, California
Dear Betty:
I am leaving on the 17th for a trip to Cairo and Capetown,
and will not be back until the middle of November. In the in-
terim, I have asked our people to keep you inforued of any re-
port fron India or Burma.
However,
since your recent telephone call, I have had a
further talk
with Mr. Bond, who is home on leave, and with one
of our CNAC pilots, both of whom are thoroughly faniliar with
the circumstances
surrounding Jeff's disappearance.
Bondy con-
firmed the statement which I believe I have previously made to
you; nemely, thet shortly efter Jeff'e plane took off, a violent
and unpredieted storn
occurred about halfway between Caleutte
and Sadiya in a heavily wooded, mountainous area near the Indian-
Burne border.
No announcement has been mede, so fer as I know, but for
your confidential information, eight Army plenes were lost that
same night in the same storm.
Several of the Army planes were
later found, some of them as much as 250 miles apart, so that
it would appesr that the storm covered a wide ares.
Every attempt
was made by the Aray, as well as by CNAC, to find the lost air-
craft.
Paratroopers were carried extensively over the area, and
the few planes that were found were located by paratroopers who
parachuted down in the neighborhood of points in the jungle where
treetops had been eut off, or bits of airplane wreckage could be
sighted from the air.
I have felt, and I know that Mr. Bond shares this view,
the only chance for Jeff wes the possibility that he might heve
survived a crash, and been taken
prisoner by the Japanese,
columns at that time were reported to be in the ares.
apparent now that Jeff did not survive the sccident, nor did any-
one else in the airplane.
It is, naturally,
with the greatest
reluetance that I write the above, but I am sure you, Betty,
would
rather know the truth than be led on by false or unwerrented assump-
tions, such as the one that reached you to the effect
that Jeff might
be a prisoner of the Lolos. As you probably know, that tribe of
